subject: Guidelines for timely decision/settlment of issues related to projects
text: 9Ra 7cl4 TTHIfurfeazsut {44 Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (7er MRaet 3 RTHT H5d4) 47 Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 HI National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 7-5 Q 6, H4rr-10, ENG, T @arit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No.11041/218/2007-Admn 11.10.2012 PQLICY CIRCULAR TECHNICAL (115/2012) (Decision taken on File No. NHAI/BOT/11019/24/2005) Sub: Guidelines for timely decision/settlement of issues related to projects It has been noticed that during the course of execution of work, the issues such as change of scope, variation, extension of time, setllement of disputes etc  are not being setlled and these issues continue to remain pending even for years. Even after the issuance of final/provisional certificate for commercial operation aS per agreement, these issues remain pending in many cases. 2 Henceforth, with approval of the Competent Authority, it is decided Ihat the following actions shall be taken by RO within his delegated power or sent to HQ with his clear cut recommendations for consideration (i) The issues related to change of scope, variations etc. should be dealt with immediately as and when the situation arises and firmed Up before COD. ii) The case related to extension of time should be immediately dealt as per   provisions of the contract and forwarded to the competent authority for decision: (iii) The   hindrances, if any, for the execution of the work should be removed at the earliest possible (iv) The pending land acouisition process, if any, should be monitored at personal level s0 that tne land as per provisions of the contract can be made available to the concessionaire/contractor . (v) The claims/disputes raised by the concessionaire/contractor should be dealt at most  pricrity within the stipulated  time period aS per provisions of the contract and speaking orders, if required, should be passed to decide the issJe. (vi) omissions on the part of the feasibility/DPR consultant leading to substantial change in scope or time overrun should be pointed out and reported to the concerned   authority to take appropriate action against that consultant. 3 It has been further decided that while recommending COD/Provisional COD under Article-1 4 of Concession Agreement for a project, the Project Director will submit an indepc Ident report duly  providing the  following information without delaying the recommendation for granting of COD/Provisional COD: a) Synopsis of project parameters duly indicating status of the completed and balance works PT ?
